semantic_title: Influenza Due to Certain Identified Influenza Viruses Coding Requirements
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 10. Chapter 10: Diseases of the Respiratory System > c. Influenza due to certain identified influenza viruses

content.full_text: Code only confirmed cases of influenza due to certain identified influenza viruses (category J09), and due to other identified influenza virus (category J10). This is an exception to the hospital inpatient guideline Section II, H. (Uncertain Diagnosis). In this context, 'confirmation' does not require documentation of positive laboratory testing specific for avian or other novel influenza A or other identified influenza virus. However, coding should be based on the provider's diagnostic statement that the patient has avian influenza, or other novel influenza A, for category J09, or has another particular identified strain of influenza, such as H1N1 or H3N2, but not identified as novel or variant, for category J10. If the provider records 'suspected' or 'possible' or 'probable' avian influenza, or novel influenza, or other identified influenza, then the appropriate influenza code from category J11, Influenza due to unidentified influenza virus, should be assigned. A code from category J09, Influenza due to certain identified influenza viruses, should not be assigned nor should a code from category J10, Influenza due to other identified influenza virus. (Evidence: pg no: 57, L73-L78)
content.summary: Specific coding requirements for confirmed influenza cases with identified viruses, including exceptions to uncertain diagnosis guidelines and provider statement requirements (Evidence: pg no: 57, L73-L78)
key_concepts: Confirmed cases only requirement (Evidence: pg no: 57, L73-L74)
Exception to uncertain diagnosis guideline (Evidence: pg no: 57, L74)
Provider diagnostic statement basis (Evidence: pg no: 57, L75-L76)
Laboratory testing not required (Evidence: pg no: 57, L74-L75)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code only confirmed cases of influenza due to certain identified influenza viruses (Evidence: pg no: 57, L73-L74)
detailed_rules.explanation: Categories J09 and J10 are restricted to confirmed cases only, not suspected or possible cases (Evidence: pg no: 57, L73-L74)

detailed_rules.rule_text: This is an exception to the hospital inpatient guideline Section II, H. (Uncertain Diagnosis) (Evidence: pg no: 57, L74)
detailed_rules.explanation: Unlike other conditions, suspected influenza cases cannot use J09/J10 codes even in inpatient settings (Evidence: pg no: 57, L74)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Coding should be based on provider's diagnostic statement without requiring positive laboratory testing (Evidence: pg no: 57, L75-L76)
detailed_rules.explanation: Provider's definitive diagnostic statement is sufficient for coding, laboratory confirmation is not mandatory (Evidence: pg no: 57, L74-L76)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If provider records 'suspected', 'possible', or 'probable', use category J11 instead of J09 or J10 (Evidence: pg no: 57, L76-L78)
detailed_rules.explanation: Uncertain terminology requires use of unidentified influenza virus category rather than specific identified virus categories (Evidence: pg no: 57, L76-L78)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify influenza diagnosis in documentation
Step 2: Determine if specific virus strain is identified
Step 3: Assess provider's diagnostic certainty (confirmed vs suspected)
Step 4: If confirmed and specific strain, use J09 or J10
Step 6: Do not require laboratory confirmation for coding

code_ranges.description: Influenza due to certain identified influenza viruses (Evidence: pg no: 57, L73, L76)
usage_rules: Provider must state definitive diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 57, L75-L76)
Do not use for suspected/possible/probable cases (Evidence: pg no: 57, L76-L77)

code_ranges.description: Influenza due to other identified influenza virus (Evidence: pg no: 57, L74, L76)
usage_rules: For specific strains like H1N1, H3N2 not identified as novel (Evidence: pg no: 57, L76)
Do not use for suspected/possible/probable cases (Evidence: pg no: 57, L77-L78)

code_ranges.description: Influenza due to unidentified influenza virus (Evidence: pg no: 57, L77)
usage_rules: Use when provider records uncertain terminology (Evidence: pg no: 57, L76-L77)
Appropriate for suspected identified strains (Evidence: pg no: 57, L76-L77)

code_patterns.description: Definitive diagnosis of identified virus uses specific categories (Evidence: pg no: 57, L75-L76)
code_patterns.explanation: Provider's definitive statement allows specific coding

code_patterns.description: Uncertain diagnosis uses unidentified category regardless of strain (Evidence: pg no: 57, L76-L77)
code_patterns.explanation: Uncertain terminology overrides specific strain identification

code_categories_mentioned: Category J09 - Influenza due to certain identified influenza viruses
Category J10 - Influenza due to other identified influenza virus
Category J11 - Influenza due to unidentified influenza virus

references_to.title: Uncertain Diagnosis
references_to.explanation: Influenza coding creates exception to general uncertain diagnosis rules

coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient diagnosed with avian influenza based on clinical presentation and epidemiological factors
step_by_step: Step 3: Confirm provider uses definitive language

correct_coding.rationale: Provider's definitive diagnostic statement supports J09 category usage (Evidence: pg no: 57, L75-L76)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should use specific J09 code when provider confirms diagnosis
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using unidentified category for confirmed specific strain

coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Suspected H1N1 influenza based on symptoms and community outbreak
step_by_step: Step 4: Assign J11 code instead of J10

correct_coding.rationale: Suspected terminology requires J11 category regardless of strain identification (Evidence: pg no: 57, L76-L77)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Cannot use J10 for suspected cases even with strain identification
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using specific strain code for suspected cases

coding_scenarios.scenario: Provider documents probable novel influenza A
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Probable novel influenza A infection, awaiting confirmatory testing
step_by_step: Step 2: Note novel influenza A specification
Step 4: Use J11 despite novel strain identification

correct_coding.rationale: Probable terminology prevents use of J09 category even for novel strains (Evidence: pg no: 57, L76-L77)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Cannot use J09 for probable cases
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using specific category for uncertain diagnosis

breakdown.J10: Other identified influenza virus category (Evidence: pg no: 57, L74)

examples.rationale: H3N2 is identified strain but not novel, confirmed by provider (Evidence: pg no: 57, L76)

warnings: Do not use J09 or J10 for suspected/possible/probable cases (Evidence: pg no: 57, L76-L78)
This is an exception to Section II, H. uncertain diagnosis guideline (Evidence: pg no: 57, L74)
best_practices: Base coding on provider's diagnostic statement, not laboratory results (Evidence: pg no: 57, L75-L76)
Use J11 for any uncertain terminology regardless of strain identification (Evidence: pg no: 57, L76-L77)
common_mistakes: Using specific strain codes for suspected cases
Requiring laboratory confirmation for J09/J10 codes
Applying general uncertain diagnosis rules to influenza
tips: Provider's definitive statement is sufficient for specific coding (Evidence: pg no: 57, L75-L76)
Uncertain terminology always leads to J11 category (Evidence: pg no: 57, L76-L77)
Laboratory testing is not required for confirmation (Evidence: pg no: 57, L74-L75)
implementation_notes: Requires careful attention to provider's diagnostic language
Exception to standard uncertain diagnosis coding practices
Strain identification alone is insufficient without diagnostic certainty
clinical_context: Influenza strain identification has public health implications
Clinical diagnosis may precede laboratory confirmation
Provider certainty is key factor in code selection
